TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor extends System.Web.UI.Design.CollectionEditorBase

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor for the collection of controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor> class provides a user interface for editing triggers of the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control. A trigger can be an <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger> object.
An instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor> class can be invoked by selecting the ellipsis button (**…**) on the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel.Triggers%2A> property in the visual designer's property grid control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The type of the trigger to edit.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor> class when the ellipsis button (…) is clicked on the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel.Triggers%2A> property in the visual designer's property grid control at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool CanSelectMultipleInstances() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function CanSelectMultipleInstances () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether multiple triggers can be selected at the same time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false`. Therefore, only one trigger can be selected every time that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor> object is used. A trigger can be an <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Type CreateCollectionItemType() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function CreateCollectionItemType () As Type

Docs.summary: Gets the data type that this collection edits.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Type[] CreateNewItemTypes() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function CreateNewItemTypes () As Type()

Docs.summary: Gets the multiple data types that the collection editor can create.
Docs.returns: An array of the data types that the can create.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The types that the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.UpdatePanelTriggerCollectionEditor> instance can create are <xref:System.Web.UI.AsyncPostBackTrigger>, <xref:System.Web.UI.PostBackTrigger>, and other types that derive from the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanelControlTrigger> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override object EditValue (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, IServiceProvider provider, object value);

Docs.param: An object that provides additional context information.

The object whose value will be edited.
Docs.summary: Edits the value of the specified object by using the specified service provider and context.
Docs.returns: The new value of the object.
